p: We identified 120 original research studies that examined mental health in the context of climate change-related exposures ( Figure 1). Sixty-seven studies reported quantitative data, 34 reported qualitative data, and 19 reported a combination of qualitative and quantitative data. The most common study design was cross-sectional ( n = 42), followed by case studies ( n = 28), modelling studies ( n = 12), ecological studies ( n = 7) and cohort studies ( n = 7). Table A1 provides a summary of the included studies.
